title: Crazy World: Man divorces wife on WhatsApp after just three weeks – because she was 'like an apple'
text:
Man divorces wife on WhatsApp after just three weeks – because she was 'like an apple' By The Mirror Sunday, Oct 11th 2015 at 10:32 
The unnamed groom was in an arranged marriage with a 21-year-old college student – but some have questioned the validity of his request to split 
A man divorced his wife over WhatsApp after just THREE WEEKS of marriage – comparing her to an apple. 
The unnamed groom was in an arranged marriage with a 21-year-old college student – but he wasn't happy. 
In an instant message to her he said she "was like an apple and he had already tasted it so he did not want her anymore". 
The girl's mother had paid the groom 10 Indian rupees and 80 sovereigns of gold for the marriage before he abruptly called it off. 
The woman then lodged a complaint at the women's commission in India after she dropped out of college, where she was studying dentistry, for the betrothal. 
The commission has now ruled that the woman's husband, a 27-year-old originally from Vaikom in Kottayam, India, must be found, the Times of India reports. 
In Islamic law, divorce can be instigated if the husband says the word 'talaq' to his wife. 
But a recent study conducted across 10 states in India has shown that oral talaq delivered through Skype, text messages, email and WhatAapp have become an increasing cause of concern for women. 
B Sugathakumari, former chair of the state women's commission, told the Times of India: "I don't think a normal youth can act in this manner. The commission should provide protection and legal aid to the girl and her mother." 
But some Islamic scholars think talaq via WhatsApp is completely valid. GO TO PAGE 1 2 Next » SIMILAR STORIES
